fields.fieldText:

{!loopOverActivityMatches.Objective__r.Name}

fields.name: Copy_1_of_txt_SC
fields.fieldText: Does this activity comply with the DNSH criteria?

fields.name: txt_dnsh_info
fields.fieldText:
Please note the following:

  • If you indicated in the previous step that the activity is not substantially contributing (0%) to the selected environmental objective, the activity will not be considered as Taxonomy-aligned even though it may comply with all of the DNSH criteria. Complying with substantial contribution is not sufficient and it is necessary to consider the DNSH criteria and minimum safeguards for an activity to be considered Taxonomy-aligned.
  • If you indicate "no" for one or several DNSH criteria of one activity, the activity will be counted as not Taxonomy aligned. If you do not know whether the activity is compliant with one or several DNSH criteria, please indicate “no”. The activity will then be counted as not Taxonomy aligned.

fields.name: Copy_3_of_txt_SC
fields.fieldText:
Modify the values of your activity fit with the substantial contribution criteria defined in the Taxonomy?


Ensure that the total aligned amounts across all the Environmental Objectives do not exceed the values shown for the corresponding Eligible Activity.

value.stringValue: Does your undertaking comply with the minimum safeguards?

fields.name: txt_MinSafe
fields.fieldText:
Note

If your undertaking cannot comply then no Taxonomy aligned Activities can be recognized.


Minimum safeguards

According to Article 18 of the Taxonomy Regulation (EU) 2020/852, the minimum safeguards referred to in point (c) of Article 3 shall be procedures implemented by an undertaking that is carrying out an economic activity to ensure the alignment with the OECD Guidelines for Multinational Enterprises and the UN Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights, including the principles and rights set out in the eight fundamental conventions identified in the Declaration of the International Labour Organisation on Fundamental Principles and Rights at Work and the International Bill of Human Rights.
